customer_addr:

Ponce De Leon, FL 32455

citations.narrative:
Sec. 3.131 Sanitation.
(c) Housekeeping.
The premise, of the area containing the enclosures for the tigers, has grown up weeds and grass, with cluttered
areas of equipment which is used for the tigers. The weeds and grass has grown up, around, and through, the
equipment and fencing surrounding the tiger area. This unkept state creates living and breeding areas for pest and
vermin, and presents a possible health problem for the tigers. The grass, weeds, and clutter, needs to be controlled
or removed to reduce health hazards for the animals.
To be corrected by August 12th, 2014.
This inspection and exit interview was conducted by the inspector, with the facility representative.
